content:
That's great to hear! Having a trusted guitar tech who's familiar with your instrument and playing style can make a big difference in getting the setup just right.

Since Joe has worked on your guitars before, he'll likely have a good understanding of your preferences and can make adjustments accordingly. It's also convenient that he's located at Guitar Central, where you purchased your amp, so you can easily drop off your guitar and pick it up when the work is done.

Before taking your guitar to Joe, you might want to make a list of the specific issues you're experiencing, such as the high action and discomfort in your left hand. This will help him understand your needs and prioritize the work accordingly.

You may also want to ask Joe about his process for setting up acoustic guitars, what kind of adjustments he typically makes, and what kind of strings he recommends. This can give you a better understanding of what to expect and help you communicate your needs more effectively.

It's great that you're taking proactive steps to address the issues with your guitar, and I'm sure Joe will do a great job in getting it playing smoothly and comfortably for you.
